comment: Very sweet lady. The 50-minute class I took was very easy.
She has a lot of experience to share. She expects that you participate in all class discussions - if you do so, class will be great!

I took this class online and it was a TON of work. We had multiple group assignments. One of our group members refused to participate. We emailed the professor and she did not seem to care. So, someone who did little to no work, was getting all of our good grades. The professor is not very clear with her instructions and graded thing extremely slow

I'm in this class online and it is a TON of work. I would say about 90% of it is group work. This is such a pain because our group has to Skype every week to get our assignments done - and it's a good thing I have a good group! All assignments are part of a huge unit plan that you build on every week. It would have been easier in-class.

Do not take! Over half way done with this class online and everyone in it is MISERABLE! Almost every single project is a group project, and there is a massive project due EVERY week.  Easily 3 times more work than in any of my other classes.  Not to mention quizzes, DB, pointless individual projects.  It is a nightmare.  Can't wait until it's over!

I am right in the middle of this class and let me tell you this is so much work! We average on about 2-3 projects per week and a discussion and quiz. Way too much. Tons of group work. I'm talking every other project is a group project. I'd pass on this one.

Almost EVERY assignment is group work.  You better hope your group is good.  She is helpful if you ask her; however, if you are expecting her initial instructions to be clear . . you will be disappointed.  She is really nice and knows a lot about teaching.  This really isn't a good class to take online.  Wish I had taken this one on campus !!
I took her online. If you put forth any effort you will do great in the class. Very easy to work with. You learn a lot to prepare you for TOSS. Responds quickly to emails.
She is a wonderful old woman. For the most part, I really enjoyed her class. The class was not difficult.

I think the ratings here are a bit harsh. Prof Rich was very available for help online and was available for conversations after each class. The work requires a lot of time and effort but that's the purpose of it. Be prepared to do two full detailed lesson plans and lots of group work. I recieved an A and just followed her thorough instructions. Don't fear this teacher.. She was very helpful and informative. This was good prep for future teachers!

OMG! Avoid if at all possible! If you rely on having a professor tell you what you're suppose to be doing for her minimally explained assignments, FORGET IT!!! Classes are BORING! but attendance is mandatory.  She drove me NUCKIN' FUTS!!!! (But she does have a great system for turning in assignments. Great with GA View)

Mrs. Rich is awesome!! There is a lot of assignments, but she is clear on directions and willing to help you out at anytime! Attendance is mandatory, but class is actually interesting. If you attend class and complete all assignments, its an easy A. I would definitely recommend her!!!

Very good teacher, and while her class is a lot of work, she is very helpful with questions. I would not say this is an easy A but i walked out of the class having learned a lot and enjoyed her teaching.  After you are done with the major project (6 weeks in) the rest of the class is very simple. Be prepared to do a little work, but it is worth it!

I felt like we had to do so much for this class all for what she said was an "Easy A", if it's going to be an easy A then why did we have SO MUCH WORK?? Lesson plans, and one big group project that will frustrate you. Ms. Rich is a very nice lady but she is not clear with her directions and leaves her students confused.
Do not take this lady!!! Makes you do so many lesson planes and grades them very HARD! I did not enjoy her class at all. Makes you do so much work!

Prof Rich is very knowledgable about teaching. She is a former high school teacher and has lots of fun stories. There was a giant group project, a unit lesson plan. If you are interested in being a teacher it should be fun though, it was for me, although a little stressful. I loved professor Rich, she cares about her students and she grades fairly.

Overall the class was fairly easy, the only hard/stressful part is the integrated unit you have to do. After that is due pretty much all the points left though are freebies, as long as you do them you should get full points. She is very nice and very funny :-)

Extremely nice, but I have been confused all semester. She is not clear in her assignments, she doesn't teach, changes her mind on exactly what is required, doesn't grade evenly. She answers questions and appears very helpful, but her responses are vague and change daily. I have an A, but it's been a struggle due to a lack of information.
